name: Mansaf
description: A traditional dish from Jordan made with lamb, rice, and a fermented yogurt sauce called jameed.

name: Kabsa
description: A popular rice dish from Saudi Arabia made with meat, vegetables, and a blend of spices.

name: Mandi
description: A Yemeni dish made with seasoned meat (usually lamb or chicken) and rice cooked in a tandoor oven.

name: Harees
description: A dish made of ground wheat and meat (usually lamb or chicken) that is popular during Ramadan in many Arab countries.

name: Shakshuka
description: A North African dish that is popular throughout the Middle East, made with eggs poached in a sauce of tomatoes, peppers, and spices.

name: Fatteh
description: A layered dish made with toasted bread, chickpeas, yogurt, and a garlic-tahini sauce, often served with meat or vegetables on top.
